Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly a pelike; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of draped male (only long garment and feet remaining) to right; on right, left side of footstool; below, groundline in black above glazed area with added red band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 468, no. B801)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0103) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
